title: Unintended change in behavior for state copy/commit between v1.12.0 and v1.12.1
body:
#### System information

Geth version:  v1.12.1 and v1.12.2

#### Expected behaviour

When I run the following code snippet, I expect both printed balances (that is, `b1` and `b2`) to be 42:

```golang
db := rawdb.NewMemoryDatabase()
st1, _ := state.New(common.Hash{}, state.NewDatabaseWithConfig(db, &trie.Config{Preimages: true}), nil)
addr := common.HexToAddress("0xaaaa")
bal := big.NewInt(42)
st1.SetBalance(addr, bal)
useCommit := true
if useCommit {
	block := uint64(0)
	deleteEmptyObjects := false
	_, commitErr := st1.Commit(block, deleteEmptyObjects)
	if commitErr != nil {
		return
	}
}
b1 := st1.GetBalance(addr)
fmt.Printf("b1: %v\n", b1)
st2 := st1.Copy()
b2 := st2.GetBalance(addr)
fmt.Printf("b2: %v\n", b2)
```

This used to be the behavior for version v1.12.0. Specifically, for version v1.12.0, the following code snippet prints 42 twice:

```golang
db := rawdb.NewMemoryDatabase()
st1, _ := state.New(common.Hash{}, state.NewDatabaseWithConfig(db, &trie.Config{Preimages: true}), nil)
addr := common.HexToAddress("0xaaaa")
bal := big.NewInt(42)
st1.SetBalance(addr, bal)
useCommit := true
if useCommit {
	deleteEmptyObjects := false
	_, commitErr := st1.Commit(deleteEmptyObjects)
	if commitErr != nil {
		return
	}
}
b1 := st1.GetBalance(addr)
fmt.Printf("b1: %v\n", b1)
st2 := st1.Copy()
b2 := st2.GetBalance(addr)
fmt.Printf("b2: %v\n", b2)
```

#### Actual behaviour

In version v1.12.1 (and v1.12.2), the first code snippet prints the following:

```golang
b1: 42
b2: 0
```

Is this an intended change in behavior? Or is this a regression due to changes related to the new storage scheme?

Note that the output does not change between the two versions if I set `useCommit` to false.

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

Run the above code snippet for v1.12.0 (second snippet) and v1.12.1 (first snippet) and compare the output.
